cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.CV. 

The paper proposes a learning rule for artificial neural networks, which is a topic that falls under the subfield of neural networks and machine learning. Specifically, the paper discusses the advantages and disadvantages of existing learning rules such as Hebbian learning and gradient descent, and proposes a new learning rule called Hebbian-descent. This places the paper in the sub-categories of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses the biologically plausible nature of the proposed learning rule, which could also place it in the sub-category of cs.SY (Systems and Control). The paper also mentions the use of the proposed learning rule in computer vision tasks, which could place it in the sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision). Finally, the paper discusses the relationship between Hebbian-descent and other learning rules such as contrastive learning, which could place it in the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
